calendar-event-select-committee.subject: The Proposals for National Policy Statements (NPSs) on Energy
calendar-event-select-committee.witness: Lord Hunt of Kings Heath OBE, Minister of State, Department of Energy and Climate Change

calendar-event-select-committee.subject: Teaching of STEM subjects (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics)
calendar-event-select-committee.witness: National Centre for Excellence in the Teaching of Mathematics, Dr Tony Gardiner, University of Birmingham, and Professor Margaret Brown, King's College London; Engineering UK, Institution of Mechanical Engineers, Royal Academy of Engineering, and Professor Peter Kutnick, King's College London (at 10.45am)

calendar-event-select-committee.subject: The impact of spending cuts on science and scientific research
calendar-event-select-committee.witness: Professor Michael Arthur, Chair, The Russell Group, Professor Paul Wellings, Chair, The 1994 Group, Professor Les Ebdon, Chair, million+, and Professor Janet Beer, Chair, University Alliance; Professor Steve Smith, President, Universities UK, Sir Alan Langlands, Chief Executive, Higher Education Funding Council for England, Dr Alastair Hunter, President, University and College Union, and Adrian Smith, Director General, Science and Research, Department for Business, Innovation and Skills (at 10.30am)

calendar-event-select-committee.subject: Scotland and the UK: cooperation and communication between governments
calendar-event-select-committee.witness: Chris Bryant MP, Minister for Europe, Foreign and Commonwealth Office
